results.content:
This course describes 100% correctly how to install and configure:
- Apache HTTP Server, 
- MySQL database server, and 
- PHP,
- Perl 
known collectively as the AMP stack, LAMP stack, WAMP stack & MAMP stack on a local development computer. If anybody needs this knowledge - you are going to find it in this course. I highly recommend it.

results.content:
Intense breakdown
The troubleshooting section was my favorite. It's always good to see errors
There are already some changes since 2018 that make some material outdated but good logic and concepts that one can use and apply.

results.content:
This instructor is very hard to understand.  I had to replay several sections of the course more than once to try and figure out what was said.  I didn’t finish the course partly because of this, but also because I was primarily interested in the LAMP stack on Linux.  

I found the instruction on the LAMP stack to be somewhat thin and I was left with an installation where the MySQL workbench had to be started using SUDO.  

It looked like the instructor had that problem also.  When the error message came up during his demo, he quickly changed screens.

I won’t be taking any more courses from this instructor.
results.content_html:

I won’t be taking any more courses from this instructor.

results.content: It's a good overview, and clarifies differences between different packages on different OS's. It moves at a very brisk pace and I did find myself going back to review sections.  I now feel the need to take a more advanced course to really understand the material, but this did provide a basis for further study..
